article_title: IEA Expects World to Rely More on Middle East Oil
article_text:
LONDON—A top energy watchdog said the world will need more Middle Eastern oil in the next decade, as the current U.S. boom wanes. But the International Energy Agency warned that Persian Gulf producers may still fail to fill the gap, risking higher oil prices.

In its first update to the agency's energy investment outlook in more than a decade, the IEA—which represents some of the world's largest consumer nations—said it sees...
